reviewText:
Not a bad little flight sim at all. Escpecially as it's only 392mb. Planes look nice and you can fly with a mouse.
In easy/arcade mode; it's an easy campaign of maybe 4 hours. I flew into the ground a few times but
didn't get shot down. On normal/arcade mode;  enemy planes take a lot more damage and seem to be
suicidal as they willl ram you and they seem to be better shots. Not quite as easy. And there's still flight mode which is harder than arcade.
Definitely worth $5.. I think I got it < $5 in the Holiday sale.
It would most likely be a lot easier to fly the planes with a joystick. You fly a Hurricane then a Spitfire.
A twin engine heavy fighter called a Whirlwind a few times and an prototype fighter
called a a Tornado. I don't think they were all that common(?); perhaps late in the war they would
have been available.

reviewText: Having been a fan of aerial combat games for some time, I acquired this as part of a humble bundle and thought I would give it a try. The controls are easy to learn, even on the hardest setting the game isn't very difficult. The graphics are mediocre, but overall it was a fun aerial combat game. I would recommend this to someone if it were on sale, or as part of a bundle where there are other games you are interested in as well.

reviewText:
Do you want to feel like a badass fighter pilot? Do you want to slaughter nazis as a member of the RAF? Pick this game up without hesitation then.

+The combat was extremely fun! I felt like an ace the entire time I was gunning germans out of the sky with my wingmen to help me.
+-The graphics are decent enough, keep in mind that the game IS from 2008. They could be better but the effort went where it was needed. Into the planes!
+-The missions are very short, but there are many of them. The game took me 2 hours to complete.
+-About 4 planes to be piloted by you. A decent amount for the game time but there always could have been more.
+This game is just some arcadey fun, honestly.
-The voice acting is mediocre.
-The story is lame.
-The cutscenes didn't seem to work on my rig for some reason.

This game has its quirks, but it is just so much god damn fun I didn't care. I'd recommened any of you try this out. This reminds me of good old arcadey fun from my childhood. It also has options to increase the difficulty and realism if you aren't a fan of arcadey gameplay. I'll give this title a 7/10.
voteText: 5 of 5 people (100%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText: Good game.  Takes about 3 hours to complete but a great arcade style casual game.
voteText: 6 of 8 people (75%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Combat is fun, but is repetitive and the same every level. Because aiming and hitboxes are inconsistent trying to use rockets is a complete waste, so you just use machine guns every level. The turret levels are the worst I've every played, because you can be shot from guys that are too far away to hit or are over your head and you cant look up high enough to see them, which seems like a huge design flaw and ruins many levels. On these levels the hitboxes and aiming are the worst. Sometimes you need to be directly on a plane to hit them, sometimes you need to be way over their head. You think you get an idea on how aiming works and then you try it again on another plane and none hit. On some planes I moved the aimer on top, slighty in front, way in front, and all around them, and none of the positions registered hitting, which showed lack of polish. No wonder this was a budget title.
voteText: 9 of 14 people (64%) found this review helpful

reviewText: The game got really repetitive really fast when all the missions feel the same. There are 23 missions to be played they all felt the same, you go and kill the enemy in the sky over and over again. The graphics got fun to watch when the sky is filled with enemy planes and you get to shoot each one down. It feels like alot of the time that you are the only one shooting all the enemies down even though you are in a squadron of planes. The voice acting was funny in the beginning of the game but after hearing the same thing multiple times it gets old. This game took me around 1-2 hours to beat. If you play it, play it in sections instead of just straight through in one sitting. The controls in the game can be a challenge in the beginning to understand but ounce you get them down then its a really easy game. The game was good but not great. Its repetitive, if you like to kill planes and not have a challenge to it then this is the game for you to burn your time with.

reviewText: Good show!  The graphics are dated and the aspect ratio isn't made for widescreen monitors, but nevermind the bullocks.  There is a great time to be had here, I say!  Toodle-pip!  Strap in, get in the air and bring it to those bloody jerries, wot wot!  That's how we save the Queen, old boy!

Controls are wonky. Repetetive Dialogue (Same voice actor for everything).

The graphics aren't bad and I actually liked the dogfights. I think that if you can get past the wonky controls then you will enjoy this game. Unfortunately, it was too much for me. I recommend using a controller or flight stick.

It's actually a challenging game once you get past all the controls.

7/10 Recommend at reduced price

reviewText:
Even with its cheap price, the game's pretty mediocre and your money could be better spent elsewhere.

The game can't really be played realistically because even on Advanced I don't feel like I'm flying an actual Hawker Hurricane or Supermarine Spitfire; much of which you fly in the game, and I feel like this experience is much more realized in any of Oleg â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥'s Il-2 Sturmovik games.

The voice acting is also a tad annoying, and it seems like most of the British voicework is by the same person. And it doesn't even sound like a WWII-era radio, it sounds much more modern.

It also doesn't seem to work with a flight stick very well. I use a Saitek CyborgX stick, and while the throttle seems to work fine, control surfaces don't seem responsive, I ended up running out of ground and exploding on the runway.

It's okay as an arcade flying game, much like the Blazing Angels series of games, but what I seek in games like these, which are historic titles, is historical realism.

If you want a good flying game that has great flight dynamics, go take a look at Il-2 Sturmovik:  1946. All I can say that's convenient about this game is that it offers a low-requirement gameplay experience for people with low-end computers like myself, but that's about it.

reviewText: The game is in a 4:3 resolution and it is not changeable = fail. Nobody has played with that resolution since monitors were huge and square and weighed fifty pounds back in 2000. The mouse is way too sensitive even on the lowest setting so I had to change sensitivity with razer synapse by alt+tabbing out. Those actually aren't the main reasons I uninstalled this, just the most heavily glaring problems. I actually gave this game a try. The game textures look like vomit and it is just not fun having to circle around and do several passes to kill targets if you miss. Oh and during the tutorial I right clicked to drop a bomb to try it out then it said for me to drop a bomb on a ground target but the bomb icon was red and I couldn't drop anymore so I was literally stuck and had to restart the tutorial. Getting one bomb in the â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ing tutorial, great game.\n\n2/10, don't bother. Go for Strike Suit Zero or Thunder Wolves for air combat that is fun and not awful.

ok, Have to say this game does not work on windows 7 64bit. When it launch's you are met with a black screen with sounds, nothing happens untill you press mouse button or keyboard keys, then it will flash and pop-up with teh game in a half sized window screen (no matter what resolution you choose it stays like that).
As soon as you make your character and hit play/launch game it crash's with a critical error report. Nothing else is said and it happens each and every single time.

Now thinking this must be a compatibility problem i went into properties and told it to run through several differant compatiblity options (in fact i think i tried most of the options going all the way down to windows 98 with no success at all.

Therefore i would have to say if you have windows 7 (64bit) dont know about 32bit, it will only give the same issue. I then went and checked out another game thats very simular (but much later) called dogfight 1942 and apparently peeps there are having the same issue's with that game too as i am having with this one :(

Therefore i have to make a semi-review of this and warn people not to bother, however if a patch is released and it fix's the issue/s i will re-review the game. Untill then head my warning to save complete dissapointment and if looking at dogfight 1942 check teh forums there for any changes as i will be.

A very addictive game. Good graphics, well thought-out missions and nice gameplay. Fly the Hawker Hurricane, Supermarine Spitfire, or when you've unlocked them: the Hawker Tornado or Westland Whirlwind. Some mission even have you being a gunner on the ground or inside a Handley Page Halifax bomber. 23 missions to keep you interested (+2 bonuses) and many different gameplay options changing the realism, making it suitable for anyone new to flight sims or a hardcore gamer.

i enjoy it

Good for a cheap fun-ride on a lazy day at home, but nothing overly special to warrant a return to it later. This type of game has been done many times before and often done much better. I used an analog game pad to play all of the flight levels and it worked relatively well but I found it impossible to use in the few gunner levels.

The gameplay is completely arcade and not at all simulation, so if you want a sim, this is not it. It's mostly enjoyable and not very difficult, it's just not that fulfilling overall. At no time would I have considered the game to be immersive and I was constantly reminded of the game: Secret Weapons Over Normandy, that I have played and I wanted for it instead, since it does everything here better.

The voice acting for the player character is atrocious but is thankfully not present too often. The other characters constantly chatter the same repeated lines ad nauseam, so it gets old fast. Also, adjusting the resolution can only offer a stretched display on a widescreen monitor, so that was a bit annoying.

I never played multi-player, so I have no opinion of its quality. Overall, the game was mildly enjoyable and I felt to get my money's worth sice I purchased it during a sale. I would recommend this game to anyone that wants a simple arcade WW2 dogfight game for a short, simple time of mediocre fun, preferably if it's on sale.

CW is a fun arcade aerial shooter. Though certainly not a flight sim and with a few drawbacks (very repetitive voice over) I could not stop playing. There is something very satisfying about taking down multiple enemy fighters within minutes. The graphics are decent, certainly far from high-end, but thus allowing people with weaker rigs to play and enjoy this little game. I would have liked it to be longer, as it takes little more than 2 hours to complete the game. Overall I think I'd fully recommend this game to anyone who likes a little casual war-time flight actions.

Don'y you hate those games, that the only reason you have it running, is so that you can make steam let you leave a review. Sadly, this is one of those game.

Not bad as an arcade flying game

The mouse controls are good enough you shouldn't have trouble.
There aren't any egregious historical mistakes, and there is plenty of content.

However it doesnt do well with 16:9 and ends up with very large black borders and even in fullscreen if you have a second monitor your mouse isnt bound and can click outside of the game (though it does autopause when that happens)

Controller support would be reasonable but fo the fact that axis bound throttle can't stop on the runway (it doesn't go to full stop for some reason) and the turret sections freak out when you use a gamepad

Voice acting (with the exception of the germans, they are cringeworthy) is acceptable for a $5 title

The missions seem well paced and there are plenty of them

For $5 this offers a few hours of fun, just dont expect a flight sim, this is very much an arcade game

A really fun game that's easy enough to get the hang of for beginners. You get to fly four separate aircraft through the course of the game, each with it's own pros and cons- I found myself pursuing different tactics depending on the aircraft I was flying. The game really gives a sense of flying and can present a challenge on higher difficulty levels.

Some cons:
- Gameplay ends up being somewhat repetative.
- Soundtrack is dull (and it's the same thing on loop for every mission)
- The physics are unrealistic. The planes don't stall, I've gotten into mid air collisions and somehow still managed to keep on flying with only minor damage.
- No artificial horizon, which sounds like a small thing, but having one would really help the player orient him/herself.

I got this game on sale for absolute peanuts, so I can hardly complain about the faults. If you enjoy flying, you'll most likely enjoy this game.
Not bad. pretty good. the only bad thing is it doesn't contain Air-to-land fight.

the game starts mouse controlled.  that makes it really hard to fly in a straight line, so i tried resetting the controls for my joystick.  It mostly worked fine, except the control for right and left moved the camera in that direction and the plane go to the opposite end of the screen.  the bad rudder control made turning harder, and occasionally just threw me off to the right.  i dont need incredibly accurate flying, but that was way too arcady and i gave up after the training mission.
I guess you're not as bad as I thought.
